thread.title: Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds set to announce Manchester Arena gig in 2017
thread.title_full: Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds set to announce Manchester Arena gig in 2017

author: Sarah Walters
title: Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds set to announce Manchester Arena gig in 2017
text:
Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds set to announce Manchester Arena gig in 2017 The Australian post punk master is headed for Manchester Share Get What's On   
Aussie rock star Nick Cave is coming to Manchester to play his biggest show in the city to date with his band The Bad Seeds. 
The singer and founder of goth-rock icons The Birthday Party will head to Manchester Arena in support of last year's album Skeleton Tree. 
Cave - who released a documentary film about his son's death and the making of Skeleton Tree in 2016, called One More Time With Feeling - has just finished a major tour of Australia and New Zealand, and is currently in Canada ahead of a string of shows across America which run until late June. 
The star is expected to hit the UK for a full national tour after the US dates. Read More New Manchester shows on sale this week including: Parklife, Celine Dion, Ed Sheeran, Russell Brand, Rat Boy 
Known for his dark sound and impressive stage presence, Cave is also a respected author and actor, and has recorded several duets with the likes of Kylie Minogue, PJ Harvey, and The Pogues' Shane MacGowan. 
The current touring lineup for Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds includes Warren Ellis, Jim Sclavunos, Thomas Wydler, Martyn Casey, Conway Savage, and George Vjestica. 
The band is currently celebrating its 34th year and 15th album since their 1984 debut From Her To Eternity. 
The exact date of the Manchester show is still to be announced - so watch this space for details. Read More
